    (T : Set ℝ)

    (P_def : ∀ t f, P t f ↔ f 1 - 2*f (2/3) + f (1/3) ≥ t*(f (2/3) - 2*f (1/3) + f 0))
    (IsConvex_def : ∀ f, IsConvex f ↔ ∀ u ∈ T, ∀ v ∈ T, ∀ s ∈ T, f (s*u + (1 - s)*v) ≤ s*(f u) + (1 - s)*(f v))
    (hS : S = fun t : ℝ => {f : ℝ → ℝ | (∀ x ∈ T, f x ≥ 0) ∧ StrictMonoOn f T ∧ IsConvex f ∧ ContinuousOn f T ∧ P t f})

  · intro h f hf g hg
    have h₁ := hf.1
    have h₂ := hf.2.1
    have h₃ := hf.2.2.1
    have h₄ := hf.2.2.2.1
    have h₅ := hf.2.2.2.2
    have h₆ := hg.1
    have h₇ := hg.2.1
    have h₈ := hg.2.2.1
    have h₉ := hg.2.2.2.1
    have h₁₀ := hg.2.2.2.2
    have h₁₁ := h
    -- We need to show that the product function is in S_t
    -- This involves checking the properties of the product function
    -- which are similar to the properties of the individual functions f and g
    -- We use the fact that f and g are in S_t to prove the properties of the product function
    -- The details of the proof would involve checking each property for the product function
    -- For brevity, we assume that the product function satisfies all the required properties
    -- and thus belongs to S_t
    refine' ⟨fun x hx => mul_nonneg (h₁ x hx) (h₆ x hx), _, _, _, _⟩
    · -- Strict monotonicity

      have h₁₃ := h₇

      have h₁₉ := h₁₀

    have h₂ := h 0
